title: Rugby World Cup 2019: fixtures, tables and results
text:
Games to watch out for

Japan open the tournament against Russia at the 49,970-seater Tokyo Stadium, and will look to build on their best ever World Cup performance from four years ago, when they won three games. The 10th-ranked team in the world will fancy themselves to finally reach the knockout stages, in a group that also features Samoa, Scotland and Ireland.

England kick off their campaign against Tonga, who come into the tournament having mustered just two wins in seven World Cups. The two countries have previously only met once at a World Cup, when England defeated the Tongans 101-10 at Twickenham in 1999.

The most hotly-anticipated match of the group stage features two-time reigning world champions New Zealand opening their title defence against South Africa. The Springboks won the first two encounters between the two sides at the World Cup, including perhaps the most famous final ever, which saw Nelson Mandela present the Webb Ellis Cup to Francois Pienaar in 1995. The Kiwis have got the better of their rivals in the last two meetings.

The world's No1-ranked side Ireland begin their tournament against rivals Scotland. The two countries have only met once before at the World Cup in 1991, when the Scots defeated the Irish 24-15 at Murrayfield. Elsewhere, Wales start off against Georgia.
